Instrument.name: Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Radio Science Subsystem
Instrument.description: The Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO) Radio Science Subsystem (RSS) was used to support the radio science investigations. The radio science investigations utilized instrumentation with elements both on the spacecraft and at ground stations -- in this case, at the NASA Deep Space Network (DSN). These investigations used radio signals to study Mars' atmosphere, ionosphere, and gravity field. By measuring the Doppler shift of the spacecraft's radio signals as it orbits Mars, the RSS provided detailed data on the Martian atmosphere's density and composition. The RSS also analyzed variations in Mars' gravity field, offering insights into the planet's internal structure, such as the distribution of mass beneath its surface. Additionally, the RSS played a role in monitoring seasonal changes in the Martian atmosphere and contributed to understanding the interaction between Mars and solar wind.
